findings.title: Block dependent information is used as seed to generate random value.
findings.description: Using block-dependent information (e.g., block.timestamp) as a seed to generate random values can be predictable by malicious actors and is therefore insecure.

findings.title: Unintended count update may occur on the CharacterInfo if isValid value is set to false.
findings.description: The characterCount storage variable is increased by 1 if the isValid value of characterInfo is set false, but there is no decrease in implementation if the isValid of characterInfo structure is true, leading to unintended increase in characterCount.

findings.title: Unnecessary require code on the ERC1155LUXON.burn function.
findings.description: The burn function has redundant ownership checks which can be removed to reduce gas fees as only superOperators can call this function.

findings.title: Unnecessary memory variable allocation on the ERC721LUXON.mintLuxOn function.
findings.description: There is an unnecessary array variable(tokenIds) in memory allocation on the process of mintLuxOn function of ERC721LUXON Contract, which can be removed to save gas fee.

findings.title: Several important variable changes have no event emissions.
findings.description: Critical variable changes lack event emissions, which can reduce project visibility.
findings.contract: Multiple contracts (DspCharacterData, DspGachaData, AirdropGachaTicket, ERC721Centralization, GachaMachineByGachaTicket, LuxOnLive, LuxOnSuperOperators)
findings.function: Multiple functions (setCharacterData, deleteCharacterData, setGachaInfo, setGachaInfos, removeGachaInfo, setMintAddress, setGachaDataAddress, setAirdropUserAddress, setAirdropRemainCount, addAirdropRemainCount, subAirdropRemainCount, airdrop, airdropMany, addToeknAddresses, setRealOwnerOnce, setRealOwner, transferCenter, setMintGoodsInfo, setCentralizationAddress, setCharacterDataAddress, setLuxOnService, setLuxOnAdmin, setOperator)

findings.title: Out of Gas error may be expected on airdropMany function
findings.description: Using a large number of AirdropInfo parameters with the airdropMany function can lead to an out-of-gas error.
